cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi (80 km) south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest later today, then north-northwest on Tuesday while passing over Puerto Rico, skirting the northern Dominican Republic, and then moving toward the southwestern Atlantic east of the Turks and Caicos

weather_observation.watch_coast: North coast of the Dominican Republic from Cabo Frances Viejo westward to Puerto Plata (Hurricane Watch); additional Tropical Storm Watches Turks & Caicos and southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico including Vieques and Culebra; Dominican Republic coast from Cabo Caucedo to Cabo Frances Viejo (Hurricane Warning); U.S. & British Virgin Islands (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Puerto Rican coastline, U.S./British Virgin Islands, northern & eastern Dominican Republic, Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts (possibly sustained 74–80 mph) expected as eyewall passes; tropical-storm-force winds already affecting the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along southern and low-lying coasts; localized coastal flooding in San Juan Bay during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–16 inches with local maxima to 25 inches producing life-threatening flash flooding and mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; potential landslides in adjacent high terrain impacting access roads and port logistics
